Class Maze

java.lang.Object
  Maze
All Implemented Interfaces:
VisibleObject
public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements VisibleObject

Maze represents the maze used by MazeRunner.

The Maze is defined as an array of integers, where 0 equals nothing and 1 equals a wall. Note that the array is square and that MAZE_SIZE contains the exact length of one side. This is to perform various checks to ensure that there will be no ArrayOutOfBounds exceptions and to perform the calculations needed by not only the display(GL) function, but also by functions in the MazeRunner class itself.
Therefore it is of the utmost importance that MAZE_SIZE is correct.

SQUARE_SIZE is used by both MazeRunner and Maze itself for calculations of the display(GL) method and other functions. The larger this value, the larger the world of MazeRunner will be.

This class implements VisibleObject to force the developer to implement the display(GL) method, so the Maze can be displayed.

Author:
Bruno Scheele

Method Detail

isWall

public boolean isWall(int x,
                      int z)
isWall(int x, int z) checks for a wall.

It returns whether maze[x][z] contains a 1.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the location to check
z - the z-coordinate of the location to check
Returns:
whether there is a wall at maze[x][z]

isWall

public boolean isWall(double x,
                      double z)
isWall(double x, double z) checks for a wall by converting the double values to integer coordinates.

This method first converts the x and z to values that correspond with the grid defined by maze[][]. Then it calls upon isWall(int, int) to check for a wall.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the location to check
z - the z-coordinate of the location to check
Returns:
whether there is a wall at maze[x][z]

display

public void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
Description copied from interface: VisibleObject
display(GL) contains all the GL callback functions to display the object on the screen.

The OpenGL functions can be accessed through the GL context, for example:

  • gl.glBegin( GL.GL_QUADS );
  • gl.glVertex3d( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 );
  • gl.glEnd();
Note that both the functions as the GL static variables are called through gl. Because the static variables should be called in a static way, we type GL in caps then, like GL.GL_QUADS.

Specified by:
display in interface VisibleObject
Parameters:
gl - the GL context in which will be drawn

paintSingleFloorTile

private void paintSingleFloorTile(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                  double size)
paintSingleFloorTile(GL, double) paints a single floor tile, to represent the floor of the entire maze.

Parameters:
gl - the GL context in which should be drawn
size - the size of the tile
